definition.name: split-list-action
definition.description: Generate a hashed list of identifiers to evenly split up.

inputs.name: ids_file
inputs.description: Text file with identifiers to split, one per line.

inputs.name: outfile
inputs.description: output file to write to (otherwise prints to screen)

inputs.name: random_split
inputs.description: change default for random split N, if using

inputs.name: calendar_split
inputs.description: split identifiers by letter matched to month (and return current day)

steps.name: Split
steps.run:
cmd="python ${action_path}/generate.py"
if [[ "${outfile}" != "" ]]; then
    cmd="${cmd} --outfile ${outfile}"
fi
if [[ "${keep_identifiers}" == "true" ]]; then
    cmd="$cmd --keep-identifiers"
fi
if [[ "${calendar_split}" == "true" ]]; then
    cmd="$cmd --calendar-split"
fi
if [[ "${calendar_split}" == "true" ]] && [[ "${random_split}" != "" ]]; then
    printf "You can only do one of `random_split` or `calendar_split`\n"
    exit 1;
fi
if [[ "${random_split}" != "" ]]; then
    cmd="$cmd --random-split ${random_split}"
fi
cmd="${cmd} ${ids_file}"
printf "${cmd}\n"
$cmd

evidence.reasoning: The action generates a hashed list of identifiers which can be used to manage dependencies or distribute tasks evenly. However, it does not fit neatly into other categories.
